description: The death toll continues to rise after the Jet Set nightclub roof in Santo Domingo tragically collapsed on Tuesday (April 8).
author: Rania Aniftos
excerpt: Cardi B is sending her love to the Dominican Republic after the tragic collapse of the Jet Set nightclub roof left at least 66 people dead.
text: The death toll continues to rise after the Jet Set nightclub roof in Santo Domingo tragically collapsed on Tuesday (April 8). Cardi B attends The 2023 Met Gala Celebrating "Karl Lagerfeld: A Line Of Beauty" at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 01, 2023 in New York City. Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images Cardi B is sending her love to the Dominican Republic after the tragic collapse of the Jet Set nightclub roof in Santo Domingo left at least 66 people dead and more than 160 injured, at the time of publication. The rapper, whose father is Dominican, wrote a message of mourning to her BG Secret Society community on Instagram Tuesday (April 8), according to a screenshot shared by Complex. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm in literal tears scrolling down my timeline seeing my Dominican people being rescued some wit lives and some gone,‚Äù¬†she wrote. ‚Äúl‚Äôm sad seeing families crying desperately in pain looking for love ones ..I feel like every Dominican around the world is in a big hora Santa praying for survivors and praying for the ones that are gone to be in Gods Glory. For the people who lost a family or a friend don‚Äôt have bad memories they left this earth singing and dancing and most likely happy and enjoying themselves and that‚Äôs how the lord will receive them.‚Äù Cardi also honored merengue singer¬†Rubby P√©rez, who reportedly died when the roof collapsed roughly an hour into his midnight performance at the club. ‚ÄúIts so heartbreaking to see one of our iconic artist [Rubby] Perez leave in such a tragic way,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad tho our final memory of him was him sharing his beautiful voice to us ..Sang one last time .I want my fans to pray for those who was in that building last night ‚ù§Ô∏èüíô‚Äù Trending on Billboard Officials urge anyone seeking updates on missing loved ones to contact the Center of Emergency Operations in Santo Domingo. html:
The death toll continues to rise after the Jet Set nightclub roof in Santo Domingo tragically collapsed on Tuesday (April 8).

Cardi B is sending her love to the Dominican Republic after the tragic collapse of the Jet Set nightclub roof in Santo Domingo left at least 66 people dead and more than 160 injured, at the time of publication.

The rapper, whose father is Dominican, wrote a message of mourning to her BG Secret Society community on Instagram Tuesday (April 8), according to a screenshot shared by Complex. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm in literal tears scrolling down my timeline seeing my Dominican people being rescued some wit lives and some gone,‚Äù¬†she wrote. ‚Äúl‚Äôm sad seeing families crying desperately in pain looking for love ones ..I feel like every Dominican around the world is in a big hora Santa praying for survivors and praying for the ones that are gone to be in Gods Glory. For the people who lost a family or a friend don‚Äôt have bad memories they left this earth singing and dancing and most likely happy and enjoying themselves and that‚Äôs how the lord will receive them.‚Äù

Cardi also honored merengue singer¬†Rubby P√©rez, who reportedly died when the roof collapsed roughly an hour into his midnight performance at the club. ‚ÄúIts so heartbreaking to see one of our iconic artist [Rubby] Perez leave in such a tragic way,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad tho our final memory of him was him sharing his beautiful voice to us ..Sang one last time .I want my fans to pray for those who was in that building last night ‚ù§Ô∏èüíô‚Äù

Trending on Billboard

Officials urge anyone seeking updates on missing loved ones to contact the Center of Emergency Operations in Santo Domingo.
